snippet: A judge ruled that California regulators violated some farmers’ rights by telling them to stop diverting from rivers and streams.
abstract: Judge Shelleyanne Chang of Sacramento Superior Court rules that California cannot fine farmers who fail to respond to water curtailment notices but that it can investigate them for illegally diverting water from rivers and streams, act that can carry hefty fines.
lead_paragraph: A judge ruled that California regulators violated some farmers’ rights by telling them to stop diverting from rivers and streams.

headline.main: Court Limits California’s Power to Punish Farmers in Drought
headline.print_headline: Court Limits California’s Power to Punish Farmers in Drought
